info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 08 at 10:30PM CDT until August 08 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SHERMAN COUNTY... At 930 PM MDT, a confirmed tornado was located 5 miles southeast of Kanorado, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Sherman County. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
